article.headline: Charlotte 80, Georgia St 65
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Curtis Withers scored a game-high 20 points and had 10 rebounds to lead Charlotte over Georgia State 80-65 on Saturday. The win handed Charlotte coach Bobby Lutz his 300th career coaching victory, which includes a 119-77 record with the 49ers in six-plus seasons. Charlotte (5-2) broke open a close game, erupting on an 18-4 run to start the second half and took a 46-31 advantage with 12:43 left in the game. The 49ers' lead reached 17 points before Georgia State (3-5) began to climb back. A 3-pointer from Boyd Copeland cut the Panthers' deficit to seven, trailing 64-57, with 3:42 left. Brendan Plavich then sandwiched 3-pointers around a dunk by Martin Iti to push the 49ers' lead to 13 with 1:35 left. Georgia State (3-5) never got closer than 10 the rest of the game. Sylvester Morgan led four Panthers in double figures with 16. Both teams rank nationally in the top-10 in 3-pointers made per game, but neither team could find its mark from long-range. The teams combined to connect on 12-of-48 three-pointers, and neither team shot better than 41 percent from the field. Charlotte shot 31 percent In the first half -- including 2-of-12 3-pointers -- and Georgia State hit 33 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
